title: Father of One U.S. Victim Found Warmth Online as Worry Became Grief
description: After frantic calls, and then devastating news, a family sees a stream of support.

title: Bolsonaro vs. Lula: On Election Day, Brazil confronts a momentous decision.
How serious is the threat of a postelection coup in Brazil?
Your Monday Briefing: Seoul Mourns Halloween Crush Victims
description: Plus Russia halts Ukrainian grain shipments and Brazilians vote for their next president.

title: Once imprisoned, a former leftist president looks to make a comeback and lead Brazil again.
The winner of the election will likely play a major role in deciding the fate of the Amazon rainforest.
Along with millions of Brazilians, Bolsonaro and Lula also headed to the polls.
Brazil’s polls were off during the first round. Now the right wants to criminalize them.
Polls have closed in Brazil. Here’s what happens next.
Brazil Election Officials Demand Answers for Police Stops of Voters
description: There were dozens of reports on social media on Sunday that federal highway agents were stopping vehicles and questioning people in several states across Brazil.

title: How a Festive Night in Seoul Turned Deadly
description: There were few police officers around as a mass of revelers swelled. From within the crowd came calls to “push, push” and a big shove, according to witnesses. Then, they began to fall.

title: For Many Disabled People, a Battle to Stay in Australia or New Zealand
description: The two countries are outliers in routinely rejecting potential migrants on the basis of medical needs, leaving families with one ill member to struggle in a legal limbo.

title: Brazil’s Runoff Faces ‘Spiritual Warfare’ for Evangelical Voters
description: Evangelical Christians make up 30 percent of the population and are a crucial voting bloc for President Jair Bolsonaro.

title: Dozens Dead in India as Suspension Bridge Collapses
description: The bridge, in the state of Gujarat, was reopened recently after renovation.

title: What to know about Brazil’s pivotal election.
Voters cast ballots amid fears and hope for Brazil’s future.
Palestinian Voters Debate Staying Home for Israeli Election
description: As Israel prepares to go to the polls again, some of the voters who helped propel an Arab party into the governing coalition for the first time are worried about a lack of results.

title: A Mother Mourns a Daughter Lost in the Seoul Crowd Surge
description: Park Ga-young was a 19-year-old university student from a small town in South Korea who dreamed of studying fashion design in Canada.

title: Why Did So Many More Women Than Men Die in the Itaewon Halloween Disaster?
description: Evidence that women may face greater risks in crowd crushes is inconclusive, an expert said.

title: How Cannibalism Became a Top Issue in Brazil’s Election
description: An old claim by Brazil’s president that he would “eat an Indian” took mudslinging to a new level.

title: Surfing in Britain? It’s Chilly but Brilliant and Widening in Appeal.
description: On the North Devon coast, where breathtaking cliffs give way to barreling waves, the surfing scene can hold its own among the best in Europe, and more girls and women are taking it on.

title: Expedition Finds Cameras Left by Yukon Mountaineers in 1937
description: Some of the cameras, from a climbing expedition 85 years ago, still had film in them. Conservators are looking to see if any images can be recovered.

title: Halloween Is a Recent Arrival in South Korea, but a Tradition in Itaewon
description: As Seoul has grown more cosmopolitan, and an increasing number of South Koreans have lived abroad and returned, Halloween has become a more popular occasion.

title: Polls Open in Brazil in High-Stakes Election Between Bolsonaro and Lula
description: Voters will choose between two of the most influential political titans in the country’s modern history in a vote for the counry’s next president.

title: Downtown Comebacks
description: The pandemic tested and reshaped the hearts of American cities.

title: Tensions Over Racism Rock Australian Netball
description: “It’s been one of the toughest few weeks of my life,” one player said.

title: Death Toll in Somalia Attack Rises to at Least 100
description: The twin explosions were the deadliest terrorist attack in the country in five years and underscored the growing threat posed by the terrorist group Al Shabab.

title: The Family of a Victim of the Seoul Crowd Surge Tried Her Phone for Hours
description: Shin Su-Bin was out celebrating Halloween with friends when her father saw reports of the deadly crush.

title: The Crowd Crush is Seoul Was Like a ‘Tsunami Wave’
description: A witness described the force of the crowd pushing him back and forth near the scene of the disaster.

title: Seoul Live Updates: Witnesses Recall Terrifying Night as Officials Seek Cause of Deadly Crush
description: “I saw this sea of bodies come rushing toward us,” one woman said. The Halloween crowd surge in a nightlife district killed at least 151 people.

title: U.S. Accuses Russia of ‘Weaponizing’ Food
description: President Biden said it was “outrageous” for Russia to withdraw from an agreement that allowed the export of grains from Ukrainian ports.

title: Witnesses Recall a Terrifying Evening in Seoul as the Crowd Surged
description: With officials unsure of what caused the disaster, recollections from people who were there are helping to paint a fuller picture.

title: Did Germany Learn From Its Russia Trouble? The Test May Come in China.
description: On the eve of Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s first trip to Beijing, concerns are growing that economic dependence on China is leaving his country vulnerable — again.

title: Did Germany Learn From Its Russia Trouble? The Test May Come in China.
description: On the eve of Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s first trip to Beijing, concerns are growing that economic dependence on China is leaving his country vulnerable — again.

title: At Least 151 Killed in Halloween Crowd Surge in Seoul
description: As many as 100,000 people were celebrating in a popular nightlife district in the center of the South Korean capital.

title: At Least 149 Killed in Halloween Crowd Surge in Seoul
description: As many as 100,000 people were celebrating in a popular nightlife district in the center of the South Korean capital.
